page.title: 07H.M.S. VICTORY
page.content: HMS Victory It is worthwhile paying a visit to Portsmouth Dockyard to see the oldest serving warship in the world, HMS Victory, built in 1765.{ You may have to queue for a little while but you don't have to pay amd a guide will show you around. The hour long tour first takes you to where Nelson slept in a kind of cot which could also be used as a coffin! Then you will go to the Admiral's cabin which is where Nelson ate and planned battles such as the famous Battle of Trafalgar of 1805. On the top deck there is a plaque showing where Nelson was shot. There are also four lifeboats here for the crew of 850. You can see where Nelson died and the mess deck where the crew ate, slept and worked. It's so interesting.
